entry.title: Sigismund Mohr (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Sigismund Mohr (pictured) lit the first electric street lamps in Quebec City to a crowd of 20,000 spectators?

entry.title: Bad for Me (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Meghan Trainor wrote her song "Bad for Me" with strangers?

entry.title: William W. Jefferis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that two railroad boxcars were needed to ship William W. Jefferis's vast mineral collection to the Carnegie Museum of Natural History?

entry.title: Fox Hill Prison (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that according to Viktor Kožený's lawyer, Fox Hill Prison in the Bahamas is known for "breaking even the toughest of men"?

entry.title: Aleksandr Trusov (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that one of the districts in the city of Astrakhan is named after Bolshevik leader Aleksandr Trusov?

entry.title: Free Woman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Lady Gaga said she was in a dark state of mind when writing the song "Free Woman" but got over it after completing the song?

entry.title: Jia Yuming (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after saying that joining the Three-Self Patriotic Movement was "against the will of God", Chinese theologian Jia Yuming joined it and became its vice chairperson?

entry.title: Secor (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that workers had to somersault to safety when the Secor Bridge collapsed in 1911?
